alston.minecraft

Class RecipeMap<T extends java.lang.Comparable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • alston.minecraft.RecipeMap<T>

  • public class RecipeMap<T extends java.lang.Comparable>
extends java.lang.Object
    Used as a generic data structure for any recipies, which requires an array of type T extends Comparable, which maps to a single type T and the Class of U, a type that represents nothing. When getting, the keys does not have to directly match the keys given, but all non-U type keys must match.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RecipeMap(java.lang.Class UClass)
      Creates a new RecipieMap by storing a refrence to the type U's class, and initiating all other Objects.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T get(T[][] key)
      Gets the Object that the given key maps to.
      void put(T[][] key, T result)
      Maps the given keys, removes all instances of U (that is not adjacent to more than 1 instance of T) and the corrosponding result.
      void sortKeys()
      Sorts the keys according to the Object's comparator (MUST be called before searching).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • RecipeMap

        public RecipeMap(java.lang.Class UClass)
        Creates a new RecipieMap by storing a refrence to the type U's class, and initiating all other Objects.
        Parameters:
        UClass - The Class of type U which MUST be a subclass of T (Cannot use assertion check due to generic type erasure)

    • Method Detail

      • put

        public void put(T[][] key,
       T result)
        Maps the given keys, removes all instances of U (that is not adjacent to more than 1 instance of T) and the corrosponding result.
        Parameters:
        key - The key for the result
        result - The Object being mapped

      • get

        public T get(T[][] key)
        Gets the Object that the given key maps to. If it does not map to anything, it returns null.
        Parameters:
        key - The keys for the Object
        Returns:
        The Object that the given keys map to; null if it does not map to anything.

      • sortKeys

        public void sortKeys()
        Sorts the keys according to the Object's comparator (MUST be called before searching).
